title: Admissions Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Robert Morris University - Pennsylvania (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online via Indeed mid March, and got an email to video interview about a month later.  I thought the interview went well, based on the follow up questions I was asked that were specific. The interviewer said that they would get back to me the following week, likely by Wednesday and I never heard anything back. It's beyond frustrating when companies take your time like this without the coutesty of a canned email message to let you know the position has been filled.
Interview Questions: Questions related to, "this is what the role entails, can you do that," sort of content.

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Robert Morris University - Pennsylvania (Moon Township, PA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back.   The process is easy if you are good on paper.  Friendly folk, softball questions, just be pro sports, and you're golden.  This was an easy process.  No stress.
Interview Questions: If you were deserted on an island, what music would you want on your IPod?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Robert Morris University - Pennsylvania (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: It is not a comprehensive interview process and they do not even have you teach a class as part of the process. They sit in a panel and ask you about your personal life and what your teaching style is like.
Interview Questions: What was it about Robert Morris that made you want to apply to the school.

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Robert Morris University - Pennsylvania (Moon, PA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Was Easy going, Explained what are the center and what we do. and I was asked if I'm ok with math or not. Then they asked me what courses I can tutor. After that they explain the process and they told to fill out the paper work. and that is it.

title: Peer Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Robert Morris University - Pennsylvania (Moon, PA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Took one semester to get approved. I applied through the career website. I did one interview. I worked there for two years. Then I got an offer. They asked me simple questions like why you want to be a tutor.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a tutor

title: Assistant Professor Accounting Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Robert Morris University - Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, then invited to the campus for interviews
Interview Questions: There were really no difficult questions asked

title: Work Study Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Robert Morris University - Pennsylvania
Interview Descriptions: Informal interview. Mostly got in by word of mouth.
Interview Questions: How will this job fit in with your career goals?

title: Associate Programmer Analyst/Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Robert Morris University - Pennsylvania in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview and then a face to face interview with everyone from the department. The phone interview lasted around 25 minutes and the efface to face lasted about 2 hours.
Interview Questions: Questions were fairly easy and straight forward

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Robert Morris University - Pennsylvania (Pittsburgh, PA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Submitted online application and heard back to interview a month later, i spoke to hiring manager to set up phone interview...phone interview was 30 minutes with hiring committee. Asked range of questions about skills, how to work in teams and problem solving examples
Interview Questions: Asked about challenges at last position and questions about software knowledge

title: Phonathon Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Robert Morris University - Pennsylvania (Moon Township, PA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview was quick and easy. Because I lived further away, they allowed for a phone interview, which was a huge help!
